page.title: 10Cottesmores' Old Houses
page.content: Our group went with Mr.Williams down to Cottesmore Village, on Tuesday 2nd July to sketch some very old houses, Mr. Williams told us that to draw, first you need to have the typical idea of the old houses, after that you draw it very gently then press a bit harder to make it show better.After doing that you can do all the details for example look at this: bricks, very old cracks on the walls, a lot of moss on the roof and shadings.Mr. Williams drew a very old cottage with a lovely thatched roof. Only one of us did the top 0f the village church (Peter). Simone drew a very old cottage with a tiled roof coverd with moss, this is one of the cottages that have a gable in the roof.The tiles came from Collyweston.
